fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-35925].
  {panel}

h2. Summary
Some PDFs render without issue when using the PDF Macro and some display blank in version 5.4.2.  When trying view the PDF in version 5.5.+, the PDF's render with garbled special characters.  

h2. Steps to Reproduce
# Download the attached PDF
# Create a new page in Confluence
# Edit the newly created page
# Drag and drop the pdf on to the page and save

h2. Expected Result
The PDF will render as other PDFs do, showing the information in the PDF correctly.

h2. Actual Result
The PDF renders blank (or in 5.5.+, with special characters and garbled text)
fields.summary: PDF Rendering Results in Blank or Garbled Text
Make possible for a Confluence administrator to see other users drafts
Administrators should be able to see and delete drafts from all users
CONF-35911

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-35917].
  {panel}

Index macro has acquired all of the pages it is in space.
If there is a large number of pages, this is the cause of high load.

https://bitbucket.org/atlassian/confluence-advanced-macros-plugin/src/eb5b70c2469f1cf6bf927d5aeec9db343d34bb5c/src/main/java/com/atlassian/confluence/plugins/macros/advanced/IndexMacro.java?at=master#cl-63

This does not necessarily have to be all pages of the space.
We want to appoint the range of the target page in a macro parameter.
fields.summary: Improve index-macro performance

fields.description:
Incorrect user shown when retrieved from JIRA, exists in the JIRA internal directory and exists in Active Directory but AD is set on the first position.

I would really suggest to improve the users screen when users exist in multiple directories, i.e. list them double where from another directory is grayed out or within the user profile notice that this user exists in more than one directory.
fields.summary: Incorrect user shown

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-35914].
  {panel}

When you install a Confluence trial, the 'generating license step' takes a long time (several minutes). 

We should improve the message that appears with the spinner to indicate that it is setting up the trial database, and that it might take a few minutes. 

Suggest replacing existing text with:   
"Generating license and setting up trial database. This might take a few minutes"
fields.summary: Improve messaging when installing Confluence trial

fields.description:
Synposis: Working with Templates in Google Chrome Version 39.0.2171.95 m (latest) does not work with Adding Variables, unless the variable has been created in another browser. It appears to be an error in the call from reviewing the Google Web Developer output.

Reproduction: Using Confluence Standalone for Windows (reported on Windows) 5.6.3, 5.6.4 and 5.6.5 (latest) issue reproduces simply on Chrome version above as follows:

# Install Confluence using PostgreSQL as the backend DB with Example Site
# Create a new Space
# Using Space Tools > Content Tools > Create New Template
# In Template, attempt to add a variable (see examples shown from Firefox and Chrome
# Variable adds as a 'New Variable' in Firefox, will not add as a 'New Variable' in Chrome
# If Variable was created in another browser, it can be added in Chrome, only *New Variables* can not be added in Chrome

Workaround for the present: Use either Firefox, Internet Explorer or Safari for Windows which do work without issue, but Chrome will not allow creation of new variables in current release.

Information shown in logs:
{code}2014-12-14 12:59:20,218 WARN [http-bio-8565-exec-5] [plugins.highlight.rest.SelectionModificationResource] getContext Could not find page with id : 819201, unable to set page in context
 -- referer: http://localhost:8565/c565/pages/templates2/editpagetemplate.action?entityId=819201&key=TES | url: /c565/rest/highlighting/1.0/panel-items | userName: admin
2014-12-14 13:02:47,674 WARN [http-bio-8565-exec-7] [plugins.highlight.rest.SelectionModificationResource] getContext Could not find page with id : 819201, unable to set page in context
 -- url: /c565/rest/highlighting/1.0/panel-items | userName: admin | referer: http://localhost:8565/c565/pages/templates2/editpagetemplate.action?entityId=819201&key=TES
2014-12-14 13:11:08,477 WARN [http-bio-8565-exec-3] [plugins.highlight.rest.SelectionModificationResource] getContext Could not find page with id : 819201, unable to set page in context
 -- referer: http://localhost:8565/c565/pages/templates2/editpagetemplate.action?entityId=819201&key=TES | url: /c565/rest/highlighting/1.0/panel-items | userName: admin {code}

More info: [CSP-136815|https://support.atlassian.com/browse/CSP-136815]
fields.summary: Variables cannot be added to Templates using Chrome

fields.description:
In the macro browser, when previewing a macro which contains other (inline?) macros (the type that allow you to type content into via the editor...I forget what they're called), only the parent macro is rendered and the contents are cut off almost completely and aren't displayed as expected.

E.g. panels, information macros, expand, section, etc. (i.e. most of the formatting macros in particular)

A couple of examples are attached via screenshots.
fields.summary: Broken macro previews when containing nested macros

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce :
# Login to Confluence
# Create a new page
# Add Chart Macro and create a table and insert data with configuration like the screenshot below :
!doubleDate.jpg|thumbnail!
Please note that the third row which have 2 dates specified for start and end is causing Confluence to crash.
# Save it and Confluence will crash after a while with the following error in the logs :
{code} -- referer: http://localhost:8900/display/SWPIT/Vacations+and+Absences | url: /display/SWPIT/Vacations+and+Absences | userName: admin | action: viewpage | page: 3473420
java.lang.OutOfMemoryError: GC overhead limit exceeded{code}

Expected behavior : It should timeout the page or prevent invalid data to be entered instead of crashing Confluence.

Current behavior : It crashes Confluence after a period of high cpu and memory usage.
fields.summary: chart macro causing Confluence to crash with high cpu usage

fields.description:
*Steps to Reproduce*

# Configure Confluence with your AD
# Ensure that AD user can login
# Set the synchronisation time to 120 to make sure that Confluence will not synchronise during this process
# Trigger the synchronisation so it won't synchronise again in 2 hours time
# Add a new group membership into your user in LDAP side
# log the user out from Confluence
# Log-in back to Confluence

*Expected Behaviour*

Confluence should not retrieve the newly configured group membership into its database as CONNECTOR unlike DELEGATION method should only retrieve group membership during synchronisation process.

*Real Behaviour*

Confluence retrieve new group membership which means Confluence CONNECTOR method also use delegation method where it will search and retrieve user information during authentication as well.
fields.summary: CONNECTOR Method Pull Group Membership During Authentication

fields.description:
{code:xml|title=seraph-config.xml}
<security-config>
	<parameters>
		<init-param>
			<param-name>login.url</param-name>
			<!--<param-value>/login.action?os_destination=${originalurl}</param-value>-->
            <param-value>http://sso.example.com/?lastPage=${originalurl}</param-value>
		</init-param>
{code}

If a user is NOT authenticated via SSO and visits this Confluence link:

https://confluence.example.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=123456
a 302 redirect to
https://sso.example.com/?lastPage=https%3A%2F%2Fconfluence.example.com%2Fpages%2Fviewpage.action%3FpageId%3D123456 is triggered, which leads the user to the SSO login and then back to the desired Confluence page, good.

However, if the user instead visits an attachment link like:

https://confluence.example.com/download/attachments/123456/example.PNG?api=v2 a 302 redirect to
https://sso.example.com/?lastPage=%2Fdownload%2Fattachments%2F123456%2Fexample.PNG%3Fapi%3Dv2 is triggered but the server base url is missing, hence there is no way to redirect the user back to the attachment after a successfull login with SSO.

I suppose, that this is related to CONF-29144.
fields.summary: ${originalurl} does not include server base url for attachment urls

fields.description:
This has been raised as a bug rather than an improvement since it is a jarring difference between Confluence Data Center and JIRA Data Center.

We should allow an admin to configure on each node a more acceptable identifier to be shown in the UI of each node, for diagnostic purposes. We currently show a small hash code in the footer.
fields.summary: Show a more user friendly node identifier in Confluence Data Center.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-35882].
  {panel}

At default, RSS Feed will only display recent created and updated contents but not the deleted ones.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new space (Let's say RSS Space).
# Create a RSS Feed using the Feed Builder.
# Subscribe to RSS Space via the RSS Feed.
# Create a page (Let's say Page A) in the space.
# Edit Page A in the space.
# Delete Page A in the space.

h3. Expected Behaviour
• RSS Feed should show all recent entries about Page A on RSS Space which includes created, updated and deleted content.

h3. Actual Behaviour 
• All recent created or updated entries of Page A will disappear from the RSS Feed when the page is removed from the space.
!rss.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: RSS Feed should includes recent deleted entries (page, blog and etc)

fields.description:
h3. Step To Reproduce
# Add a Page tree macro in a page
# Export the page to PDF or Word

Example Page:
!sample.png|thumbnail!


h3. Expected Result
The content of "page tree macro" is visible in the PDF or Word export

h3. Observed Result
The content of "page tree macro" is completely omitted from the exported content. 
[^Result.pdf]
fields.summary: Export to word does not include the Page Tree Macro.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-35877].
  {panel}

Hello,

i am trying to update a confluence 3.0.2 instance. the data is on an oracle database - i got a empty scheme to test the update - i copy the data from the live-system to the test-db, works fine. i tried it with 3.5 and 3.5.17. i unzip the file, add ojdbc6.jar, edit confluence-init.conf to point to a copy of the confluence home, i edit server.xml to have the database connection

<Resource
							name="jdbc_confluence"
							auth="Container"
							type="javax.sql.DataSource"
							driverClassName="oracle.jdbc.OracleDriver"
							url="jdbc:oracle:thin:@(DESCRIPTION=(ADDRESS_LIST=(ADDRESS=(PROTOCOL=TCP)(HOST=DB_HOST)(PORT=1521)))(CONNECT_DATA=(SERVER=DEDICATED)(SID=DB_SID)))"
							username="db_user"
							password="db_pwd"
							connectionProperties="SetBigStringTryClob=true"
							maxActive="25"
							maxIdle="5"
							maxWait="600"
							removeAbandoned="true"
							validationQuery="select 'validationQuery' from dual"
					 />
and add this:

<resource-ref>
		<description>Connection Pool</description>
		<res-ref-name>jdbc/confluence</res-ref-name>
		<res-type>javax.sql.DataSource</res-type>
		<res-auth>Container</res-auth>
	</resource-ref>

to the server.xml


after starting confluence it recognizes it has to update, but everytime i get erros while trying to update the database - cannot create foreign keys, they are already there ... i tried it with stopping confluence, drop the foreign keys manually and proceed with the update ... after doing this about 20 times the update is finished - but the data is trash ... i can see confluence and i can log in ... but no other site will be visible - all i can see is this error in the source:

Error occurred during template rendering: Invocation of method 'getOpenSearchTitle' in  class com.adaptavist.confluence.builder.BuilderVelocityHelper threw exception java.lang.NoSuchMethodError: com.atlassian.confluence.spaces.SpaceDescription.getRealTitle()Ljava/lang/String; at templates/builder/theme/main.vmd[line 102, column 89]. Contact your administrator for assistance.

i tried it with dropping every foreign keys beore update - this way the update completed without sql-errors, but the site is broken afterwards.

i need help upgrading this confluence!

and yes i tried it with xml-backups, but this is even more buggy. i've attached the newest xml-backup.
fields.summary: No Upgrade possible from 3.0.2

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-35876].
  {panel}

Steps to reproduce :
# Login to Confluence
# Create a new page
# Type some text all the way to the bottom of the editor until it is not visible on your monitor
# Scroll all the way up of the page
# Try to search the text that is at the bottom of the page using Confluence in-built editor search.
# It does not go to the bottom of the page, however if you scroll down the page it have already highlighted the text

Expected behavior : When searching text in the bottom of the page, it will highlight the text and also scroll all the way down to the text position.

Current behavior : When searching text in the bottom of the page, it will highlight the text but it will not scroll all the way down to the text position.

ps: this issue occurs in Google Chrome only
fields.summary: search text does not jump to the position of the text that resides at the bottom of the page when editing page

fields.description:
I am running Confluence 5.6.5.  I would like to implement some additional tasks using a remote API.  The REST API (documented at https://docs.atlassian.com/atlassian-confluence/REST/latest/) is missing most of the functionality of the XML-RPC API (documented at https://developer.atlassian.com/display/CONFDEV/Remote+Confluence+Methods).  Your documentation seems to indicate you are abandoning the XML-RPC API in favor of the REST API.

The following elements of the XML-RPC API are broken:
getActiveUsers (noSuchMethodException)

There was another one, but I can't think of it at the moment.

I have been very happy with the functionality of the XML-RPC API in the past.  I hope you don't intend to eliminate it without providing a viable alternative.  But it seems to me that the documentation and functionality of your remote APIs are in some disarray.
fields.summary: REST inadequate, XML-RPC broken

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-35858].
  {panel}

*The situation*
# Having note / warning macro within a Confluence page. 
# Page is exported to PDF, coincidentally, the location of the macro box is  at the end of a page break

*What happens*
# The macro box split into 2 parts, before and after the page break (see sceenshot)

*What is expected*
# The box should start in the next page
# The box should be closed in he first page, Have another box on the second page
fields.summary: Note or Warning macro box should not split when there is a page break in PDF export
Provide a way to create new page versions when attaching files to that page

fields.description:

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-35856].
  {panel}

h3. ***Current Behavior***
Currently it is only possible to set the width of the gadget in a Confluence page.

h3. ***Improvement Request***
The gadget should be resizable for height as well as width.

fields.description:
When Confluence 5.6.4 tries to restore a previous version of a page, the following options are displayed in a warning yellow box. 

{code}You are viewing an old version of this page. View the current version.
Compare with Current - Restore this Version - View Page History{code}

The Link "Restore this version" lamentably does nothing. To restore a previous version you must do the following:

Compare with Current > View Page History > Restore this version

I have not tested it on confluent 5.6.5.
fields.summary: Confluence 5.6.4: "Restore this Version" not work.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-35853].
  {panel}

Ticket CONF-7526 has been open for the last 7 years.

It is very active: ever since I posted a comment about my own poor experience 3 weeks ago, there have been 8 additional comments, from 6 different complaining users - all for a 7-year-old ticket!
And all of them are complaining about a particular horrible piece of user experience within Confluence.

Depite all of these complaints, it appears that other than Atlassian users, nobody at Atlassian cares about this ticket. The most recent comment by an Atlassian employee was almost 4 years and 34 comments ago!

When are you guys going to at least stop ignoring your users who keep complaining about this? Please respect us by at least considering what your users keep complaining about for such a long time.
fields.summary: Atlassian support process has a long-standing ticket falling through the cracks

fields.description:

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-35842].
  {panel}

Currently the following doc has a tag structure that can cause tags to be closed prematurely:

- https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONF54/Configuring+database+query+timeout

We instruct the following:
1.
{noformat}
<bean id="transactionManager" class="org.springframework.orm.hibernate.HibernateTransactionManager">
    <property name="sessionFactory">
        <ref bean="sessionFactory"/>
    </property>
    <property name="defaultTimeout" value="120"/>
</bean>
{noformat}

While the following changes need to take place:

2.
{code:xml}
    <bean id="transactionManager" class="org.springframework.orm.hibernate.HibernateTransactionManager" plugin:available="true">
        <property name="sessionFactory" ref="sessionFactory"/>
        <property name="defaultTimeout" value="120"/>
    </bean>
{code}
fields.summary: Update Documentation Regarding Query Timeout to Match Current XML structure

The following appears in the {{atlassian-confluence.log}}:
{code} 
Job (DEFAULT.IndexQueueFlusher threw an exception.
org.quartz.SchedulerException: Job threw an unhandled exception. [See nested exception: com.atlassian.bonnie.LuceneException: com.atlassian.bonnie.LuceneException: Couldn't open writer on directory: org.apache.lucene.store.SimpleFSDirectory@D:\confluence-home\index lockFactory=org.apache.lucene.store.SimpleFSLockFactory@1630667]
	at org.quartz.core.JobRunShell.run(JobRunShell.java:210)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.schedule.quartz.ConfluenceQuartzThreadPool$1.run(ConfluenceQuartzThreadPool.java:14)
	at org.quartz.simpl.SimpleThreadPool$WorkerThread.run(SimpleThreadPool.java:549)
Caused by: com.atlassian.bonnie.LuceneException: com.atlassian.bonnie.LuceneException: Couldn't open writer on directory: org.apache.lucene.store.SimpleFSDirectory@D:\confluence-home\index lockFactory=org.apache.lucene.store.SimpleFSLockFactory@1630667
	at com.atlassian.bonnie.LuceneConnection.withBatchUpdate(LuceneConnection.java:409)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.search.lucene.DefaultConfluenceIndexManager.processTasks(DefaultConfluenceIndexManager.java:161)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.search.lucene.DefaultConfluenceIndexManager.flushQueue(DefaultConfluenceIndexManager.java:128)
	at sun.reflect.GeneratedMethodAccessor826.invoke(Unknown Source)
	at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:25)
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:597)
	at org.springframework.aop.support.AopUtils.invokeJoinpointUsingReflection(AopUtils.java:304)
	at org.springframework.aop.framework.ReflectiveMethodInvocation.invokeJoinpoint(ReflectiveMethodInvocation.java:182)
	at org.springframework.aop.framework.ReflectiveMethodInvocation.proceed(ReflectiveMethodInvocation.java:149)
	at org.springframework.transaction.interceptor.TransactionInterceptor.invoke(TransactionInterceptor.java:106)
	at org.springframework.aop.framework.ReflectiveMethodInvocation.proceed(ReflectiveMethodInvocation.java:171)
	at org.springframework.aop.framework.JdkDynamicAopProxy.invoke(JdkDynamicAopProxy.java:204)
	at $Proxy39.flushQueue(Unknown Source)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.search.lucene.IndexQueueFlusher.executeJob(IndexQueueFlusher.java:29)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.setup.quartz.AbstractClusterAwareQuartzJobBean.surroundJobExecutionWithLogging(AbstractClusterAwareQuartzJobBean.java:63)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.setup.quartz.AbstractClusterAwareQuartzJobBean.executeInternal(AbstractClusterAwareQuartzJobBean.java:46)
	at org.springframework.scheduling.quartz.QuartzJobBean.execute(QuartzJobBean.java:86)
	at org.quartz.core.JobRunShell.run(JobRunShell.java:199)
	... 2 more
Caused by: com.atlassian.bonnie.LuceneException: Couldn't open writer on directory: org.apache.lucene.store.SimpleFSDirectory@D:\confluence-home\index lockFactory=org.apache.lucene.store.SimpleFSLockFactory@1630667
	at com.atlassian.bonnie.LuceneConnection.withWriter(LuceneConnection.java:346)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.search.lucene.tasks.LuceneConnectionBackedIndexTaskPerformer.perform(LuceneConnectionBackedIndexTaskPerformer.java:20)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.search.lucene.DefaultConfluenceIndexManager$BatchUpdateAction.perform(DefaultConfluenceIndexManager.java:361)
	at com.atlassian.bonnie.LuceneConnection.withBatchUpdate(LuceneConnection.java:405)
	... 19 more
Caused by: org.apache.lucene.store.LockObtainFailedException: Lock obtain timed out: SimpleFSLock@D:\confluence-home\index\write.lock
	at org.apache.lucene.store.Lock.obtain(Lock.java:85)
	at org.apache.lucene.index.IndexWriter.init(IndexWriter.java:1562)
	at org.apache.lucene.index.IndexWriter.<init>(IndexWriter.java:1118)
	at com.atlassian.bonnie.LuceneConnection.withWriter(LuceneConnection.java:327)
	... 22 more
{code}
Also, this may happened if you have an insufficient disk space. One of the contributors to this is scheduled daily backup, which can turn out to be large.

h5. Workaround
Delete {{write.lock}} from {{<confluence-home>/index/}}. If that only helps temporarily, check your Confluence home directory for any insufficient disk space. Please also refer to [this KB|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONFKB/com.atlassian.bonnie.LuceneException+Couldn%27t+open+writer+on+directory].

*Update for Confluence 5.3.1:*
The {{write.lock}} file is now removed from {{<confluence-home>/index/}} and {{<confluence-home>/index/edge/}} during a restart. Please, let us know if you are still experiencing this problem in 5.3.1 and newer versions.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-35799].
  {panel}

*Bug Overview*

Confluence {{viewpowerpoint}} unable to render a powerpoint attachment successfully and the spinner never stop spinning. {{atlassian-confluence.log}} will reveal the following stack trace

{code}
2014-12-03 21:00:19,676 ERROR [DefaultSlideCacheManager:thread-1] [com.benryan.conversion.AbstractSlideConversionTask] call problem while converting noname.ppt
 -- url: /plugins/servlet/pptslide | userName: admin | referer: http://localhost:5440/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=2129922
org.apache.poi.poifs.filesystem.OfficeXmlFileException: The supplied data appears to be in the Office 2007+ XML. You are calling the part of POI that deals with OLE2 Office Documents. You need to call a different part of POI to process this data (eg XSSF instead of HSSF){code}

*Workaround*

In order to workaround this issue, it is necessary to disable PowerPoint attachment indexing. This means Confluence will not index the content of PowerPoint attachment, however the title of it will still be indexed and searchable.

# Go to *Confluence Admin* > *Manage Add-ons*.
# Toward the middle of the screen is a pulldown menu that says User Installed. Change it to All Add-ons. 
# Scroll down to *Office Connector* under *System Add-ons*
# Expand *Office Connector* plugin
# Click the + sign next to "*x of x modules enabled*"
# Disable the following modules:
#* Powerpoint 97 Content Extractor

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-35796].
{panel}
h3. Problem Definition

User mentioning is possible for any users on the instance, regardless of the page you are mentioning on. This causes a problem if you've mentioned someone but they don't have permissions to see the page, and so they won't see your comments. The user does not get any notifications.
h3. Suggested Solution
 - Either show a warning that the user does not have permission to view the page
 - Or only list the users that are able to view. First option is probably better.

 h3. Workaround
Go to ... > *People who can view* for a simple list of all the people who:

* are allowed to view the space, via space permissions, and
* are not prevented from viewing the page by page restrictions.
fields.summary: Restrict mentions to users who have permission to view current page
The ability for some users to maintain user groups

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-35792].
  {panel}

h5. Summary
Create Page window is not showing any template, but a blank window instead when accessed through JIRA Agile's Planning mode

h5. Environment
JIRA 6.3.10, 6.3.12
Confluence 5.6.3, 565

h5. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a user (example: _test_) in JIRA that has the *Administer Projects* permission
# Create an application link between JIRA and Confluence
# Create a new user in Confluence with the same username and remove that user from any groups
# Give the user "Can Use" permission ONLY, in Confluence Global Permissions
# Ensure that there are no spaces in Confluence with Anonymous access permission, so that the user will be in read-only mode.
# Install JIRA Agile in JIRA
# Create a Scrum project
# Login as user _test_
# Click the *Linked Page > Create Page* button in Scrum's Plan mode

h5. Expected Results
User will be shown something like an error or _not permitted_ page. This is because anonymous users are not allowed to create contents in Confluence.

h5. Actual Results
Create Page dialog will pop-up, and the Loading icon will spin endlessly. The *Create* button seems to be missing as well.
!loading.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Throw a 'Not Permitted' message when creating a page on a Read-Only Confluence, through JIRA Agile Planning Mode
